definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: The result is that many have jeopardized their performance in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 結果就使得他們在長遠經營中蒙受一定的損失。

sentences.english: I: What is your long-range objective?
Your vision, and a proactive approach, can help you avoid this pitfall.
sentences.chinese: 長遠的眼光和積極的方式能助你避免跳入這種陷阱。

sentences.english: Number four, the central authorities have already approved the long-term plan for the reform and development of the pearl river delta region.
sentences.chinese: 第四，中央已經批准珠三角改革和發展的長遠規劃。

sentences.english: No. 4, the central authorities have already approved the long-term plan for the Reform and Development in the Pearl River Delta region.
sentences.chinese: 第四，中央已經批准珠三角改革和發展的長遠規劃。

sentences.english: It has been rather costly to install the machinery, but it should pay off in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 安裝這套機械代價很高，但從長遠來看它會賺錢的。

sentences.english: So might investors or businesses, which need to plan for the long term.
sentences.chinese: 需要長遠打算的投資者和企業可能也一樣。

sentences.english: It is also encouraging the purchase and consumption of local produce, communicating its long-term benefits.
sentences.chinese: 從長遠的利益考慮，鼓勵自產自銷是基本立足點。

sentences.english: Slightly happy if you lower your levels of expectations, but not in the long term.
sentences.chinese: 降低期望水平會略微快樂些，但從長遠來說行不通。

sentences.english: He says the betting rings are well-funded and have long-term plans.
sentences.chinese: 他說，賭球團夥的資金非常雄厚，有着長遠的計劃。

sentences.english: Green production, so to speak, will be tremendously beneficial to a business' long-term development.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，綠色生產對一家公司的長遠發展裨益甚大。

sentences.english: The Betta has had a long history in Thailand and is one of Thailand's traditional fish.
sentences.chinese: 鬥魚在泰國具有長遠的歷史，是泰國一種傳統的魚只。

sentences.english: "This is a significant step forward in the search for future treatments for preterm labour," says Dr Tribe.
sentences.chinese: 這項結果對今後早產治療研究是有長遠意義的。

sentences.english: This time will pay off for you in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的時間是用來做長遠打算的。

sentences.english: But in the long run,it doesn't help,if it's only that.
sentences.chinese: 但從長遠來看，僅僅這樣做並沒有幫助。

sentences.english: Be wary of prepaying for long-term arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 警惕預先爲長遠的安排。

definition: to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
one step further/to move forward a step/further onwards
whole entity/entire body/synthesis/as a whole (situation, construction, team etc)/global/macrocosm/integral/holistic/whole
